text.p: Saudi Arabia on Friday beheaded two men, a Saudi for fatally shooting a relative and a Pakistani for smuggling drugs into the kingdom, bringing to 18 the number of executions in the Gulf Arab state this month.
The Saudi Interior Ministry, in separate statements carried by the official Saudi Press Agency (SPA), said both men were beheaded in the Saudi capital Riyadh.
It said a court found Msafar bin Nouwar al-Utaibi guilty of killing Mitleq bin Hleil al-Utaibi. It did not say how both men, who hail from a large Saudi tribe, were related.
It said a court also found a Pakistani man guilty of smuggling unspecified quantities of heroin into the kingdom.
The executions raised to 41 the number of people put to death this year in Saudi Arabia, which enforces Islamic sharia law by publicly beheading convicted murderers, drug smugglers and rapists.
